body.p: Pyzor is a collaborative, networked system to detect and block spam using identifying digests of messages.

Pyzor initially started out to be merely a Python implementation of Razor, but due to the protocol and the fact that Razor's server is not Free Software, I decided to Pyzor should be based upon a new, lighter, more language-independent protocol.

Feel free to download Pyzor and join the pyzor-announce or pyzor-users mailing lists. All users are recommended to join the pyzor-announce list, as information about new releases and popular public servers will be posted to it.
Users are encouraged to read Steps to block spam with Pyzor so they are aware of how Pyzor should fit into their overall scheme, and to realize that Pyzor is meant to complement other techniques.
Colin Smith has an excellent overview of how Pyzor works.
